medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 18 when the patient first presented with primary amenorrhea. She received estrogen treatment to induce breast development and underwent several ovulation induction attempts due to infertility, with varied responses and a history of conceiving twice. At the time of assessment, she had Tanner I breast development and no secondary sexual characteristics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with idiopathic hypogonadotropic hypogonadism (IHH) and underwent treatments including estrogen and human menopausal gonadotropin (HMG). Previous infertility treatments included pulsatile GnRH and ovulation induction.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of delayed puberty, cleft palate, dental agenesis, renal agenesis, or anosmia. The family was normosmic without reported health conditions associated with hypogonadism.
